intro: Cynanchum capense, commonly known as the Cape milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae, which includes many species of milkweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, clustered in umbels, and produce a milky sap that is toxic to some animals. Cynanchum capense is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
